creditline: Gift of Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo
description: two very large, bold characters; two large red seals at left edge, center; one red seal, URC
text:
“Bring the Qin” refers to the final line of a poem by the Tang dynasty literatus, Li Bai (701–762). The qin is a seven stringed instrument which is plucked. Nakae’s poem, entitled “Drinking with a Hermit in the Mountains” reads:
Two of us drinking together as mountain blossoms open;
One cup, another cup, still one more cup—
I’m feeling a bit drunk and the time has come for you to depart,
But tomorrow morning, if you like, come again and bring the qin!
title: Bring the Qin
